ns1:Asset.ns1:name: MWS2R3 - AD Create Active Directory
ns1:Asset.ns1:body:
# ScriptName: AD Create Active Directory # Author: Mark Freeman # Required Variables: None # Description: # # Installs Active Directory Role and Management Tools # Runs DC Promo to create the resource domain # Registers the DCs IP address in the key value store as Primary DNS server
#include dynamic data store # Load Common functions . .\Logging.ps1 . .\GlobalRepository.ps1 . .\LaunchProcess.ps1 . .\FilesUtility.ps1
write-output "Installing Active Roles Management." Start-Process "msiexec.exe" -ArgumentList "-i $scriptPath\ActiveRolesManagementShell_x64_1.6.0.msi /q"-Wait write-output "Active Roles Management installed."
#install roles and features
$addsTools = "RSAT-AD-Tools"
Add-WindowsFeature $addsTools #Install AD DS, DNS and GPMC
start-job -Name addFeature -ScriptBlock { Add-WindowsFeature -Name "ad-domain-services" -IncludeAllSubFeature -IncludeManagementTools Add-WindowsFeature -Name "dns" -IncludeAllSubFeature -IncludeManagementTools Add-WindowsFeature -Name "gpmc" -IncludeAllSubFeature -IncludeManagementTools } Wait-Job -Name addFeature
# Create New Forest, add Domain Controller
$domainname = (get-globalvariable "Global/DomainFQDN").value $netbiosName = (get-globalvariable "Global/DomainNetBIOS").value $dsrmPassword = (get-globalvariable "Global/DomainDSRMPassword").value $secure_string_pwd = convertto-securestring $dsrmPassword -asplaintext -force
write-output "Domainname: $domainname [$netbiosname]"
Import-Module ADDSDeployment Install-ADDSForest -CreateDnsDelegation:$false ` -DatabasePath "E:\NTDS-DB" ` -DomainMode "Win2012" ` -DomainName $domainname ` -DomainNetbiosName $netbiosName ` -SafeModeAdministratorPassword $secure_string_pwd ` -ForestMode "Win2012" ` -InstallDns:$true ` -LogPath "L:\NTDS-Logs" ` -NoRebootOnCompletion:$true ` -SysvolPath "E:\SYSVOL" ` -Force:$true `
$dynamicdata = "AD\PrimaryDNS" $ip = Get-NetIPAddress | Where-Object -FilterScript {$_.AddressFamily -eq "IPv4" } | Where-Object -FilterScript {$_.IPAddress -ne "127.0.0.1"} $ipa = $ip.IPAddress Set-globalvariable $dynamicdata $ipa
write-output "Sleeping for 2 minutes" Start-Sleep -s 120 write-output "Done"
